name: market for aluminium, primary, ingot | aluminium, primary, ingot | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23037/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'aluminium, primary, ingot', in the geography of IAI Area, North America.; About 15-20% of the North American consumption of primary is from imports. These imports are coming mainly from 3 areas (Russia, Middle East and South America). Average transport is considered for these imports in the market. ;This product is generally considered to be used at the production site.  Therefore, the market does not contain any transport for aluminium produced in North America. 

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'aluminium, primary, ingot',  within the geography of IAI Area, North America.

This activity ends with the supply of 'aluminium, primary, ingot',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Market for aluminium consumed in North America (Canada and US)

exchanges.description: The imported ingots are shipped by boat (9100 km, weighted average distance from the 3 mains import areas). These imported ingots represent 18.8% of the ingot consumed in North America. The ingots produced in North America are generally consummed locally : no transport is included in this case.
